result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Patrick Sustek

records.addlTxt:
2:21 PM Defendant Christopher Patrick Sustek appeared by phone.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Christopher Patrick Sustek.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty asking for breakout with def.  Back on the record at 2:26.  Atty, discussed charges and potential penalties, waive reading, plead NG, noted.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:45 AM Defendant Christopher Sustek in court.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer in court for Christopher Sustek.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, we are continuing with prelim.  State calls Officer Gilbertson, sworn in, State questions.  Atty no questions.  State makes argument.  Atty makes argument.  Court finds PC that def committed a felony in Ashland County case is bound over for arraignment.  State filing information now, contains same counts as in criminal complaint.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:10 AM Defendant Christopher Sustek appeared by phone.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by phone for Christopher Sustek.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, recv'd complaint, waives reading, request prelim hearing in statutory time limits.  Stipulation on def appearing by video otherwise needs to appear in person.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.addlTxt:
9:28 AM Defendant Christopher Sustek appeared by phone.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  If no atty by next court date court will appoint an atty.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
SPD Attorney Status
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:28 AM Defendant Christopher Sustek appeared by phone.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Christopher Sustek.   Cases 21CM12 and 22CF88.  22CF88 here for AIA still waiting for PD.  21CM12 motion granted to vacate DEJ, judgment entered and here for sentencing.  22CF88 adjourning case to 8/29/22 at 9 am, can appear by zoom.  21CM12 there is no agreement for sentencing.  Def waives right to personal appearance, discussed with attorney.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving right to personal appearance, court accepts waiver.  State has complied with victim rights.  State comments on sentencing.  Attorney comments with sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  Court orders in CT 1, fine of $100 plus costs, mandatory DNA contact Ashland sheriff with in 7 days, financial through Ashland county $25 a month starting September 1st and on or before the first of every month until paid in full, cash bail posted will be applied.
OSPD Apptmt of Counsel Rpt
Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:08 AM Attorney Ruth Kressel.   appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Christopher Sustek.  Defendant Christopher Sustek appeared by phone.  21CM12 represented.  22CF88 report from SPD has not found attorney yet.  Atty agrees he is not representing in 22cf88.  21CM12 need a sentencing hearing.  Can zoom, def has right to make personal appearance if chooses.  Def states he does not agree with attorney, court already ruled, sentencing hearing is going to be scheduled.  22CF88 will track at this point for AIA.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
SPD Attorney Status

9:13 AM Prosecuting attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Sustek appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Christopher Sustek. 21CM12,22CF88-- Here on motion to vacate DEJ and enter judgement. State comments-- not schd SEH at this time, but to track with the new case to try and get a globel agreement. Atty is not on new case and not sure if he will take the new case or not. Def has not contact SPD. Wants an atty to represent him on the new case. 21CM12- Atty comments, def would like to make an argument. Back on the record 9:31am-- State comments on the evid. 
21CM12-- Atty comments, stipulate that the def did not give info on time. Def comments, could not find MRT class to complete. Ct comments on the agreement and motion. 
Ct orders-- Judgment entered. Will track cases for sentencing. 
22CF88-- Contact SPD ASAP
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
